ProductInfo.BookActualName: Into Thin Air
ProductInfo.Discription: Into Thin Air: A Personal Account of the Mt. Everest Disaster is a 1997 bestselling non-fiction book written by Jon Krakauer
ProductInfo.Author: Jon Krakauer

ProductInfo.BookActualName: Treasure Island
ProductInfo.Discription: Treasure Island is an adventure novel by Scottish author Robert Louis Stevenson, narrating a tale of 'buccaneers and buried gold.'
ProductInfo.Author: Robert Louis Stevenson

ProductInfo.BookActualName: My Sister’s Lies
ProductInfo.Discription: The USA Today and Kindle Top #25 Bestseller ‘A real tear-jerker’ THE SUN ‘A stunning read’ MIRANDA DICKINSON For a decade, Hannah’s life has been pretty close to perfect – she has a great job, she’s married to Mark
ProductInfo.Author: S. D. Robertson

ProductInfo.BookActualName: Beyond the Trees: A Journey Alone Across Canada's Arctic
ProductInfo.Discription: A thrilling odyssey through an unforgiving landscape, from 'Canada's greatest living explorer'
ProductInfo.Author: Adam Shoalts

ProductInfo.BookActualName: Running Home: A Memoir
ProductInfo.Discription: In the tradition of Wild and H Is for Hawk, an Outside magazine writer tells her story—of fathers and daughters, grief and renewal, adventure and obsession, and the power of running to change your life.NAMED ONE OF THE BEST BOOKS OF THE YEAR BY REAL SIMPLEI’m running to forget, and to remember.
ProductInfo.Author: Katie Arnold

ProductInfo.BookActualName: She Explores: Stories of Life-Changing Adventures on the Road and in the Wild (Solo Travel Guides, Travel Essays, Women Hiking Books)
ProductInfo.Discription: For every woman who has ever been called outdoorsy comes a collection of stories that inspires unforgettable adventure.Beautiful, empowering, and exhilarating, She Explores is a spirited celebration of .
ProductInfo.Author: Gale Straub

ProductInfo.BookActualName: Good Economics for Hard Times
ProductInfo.Discription: Good Economics for Hard Times: Better Answers to Our Biggest Problems is a non-fiction book by Abhijit V. Banerjee and Esther Duflo, both professors of Economics at MIT. It was published on November 12, 2019 by PublicAffairs, Juggernaut Books and Allen Lane.
ProductInfo.Author: Esther Duflo, Abhijit Banerjee

ProductInfo.BookName: The Warren Buffet Way Third Edition
ProductInfo.BookActualName: The Warren Buffet Way Third Edition
ProductInfo.Discription: The first two editions of The Warren Buffett Way gave investors their first in-depth look at the innovative investment and business strategies behind the spectacular success of living legend Warren E. Buffett.
ProductInfo.Author: Robert Hagstrom

ProductInfo.BookName: The Greate Reversal How America Gave Up on
ProductInfo.BookActualName: The Great Reversal: How America Gave Up on Free Markets
ProductInfo.Discription: American markets, once a model for the world, are giving up on competition. Thomas Philippon blames the unchecked efforts of corporate lobbyists. Instead of earning profits by investing and innovating, powerful firms use political pressure to secure their advantages..
ProductInfo.Author: Thomas Philippon

ProductInfo.BookName: Raghuram G. Rajan The Third Piller
ProductInfo.BookActualName: The Third Pillar: How Markets and the State Leave the Community Behind
ProductInfo.Discription: SHORTLISTED FOR THE FINANCIAL TIMES AND MCKINSEY BUSINESS BOOK OF THE YEAR AWARD 2019 From one of the most important economic thinkers of our time, a brilliant and far-seeing analysis of the current populist backlash against globalization.
ProductInfo.Author: Raghuram Rajan

ProductInfo.BookName: Narrative Economics: How Stories Go Viral
ProductInfo.BookActualName: Narrative Economics: How Stories Go Viral and Drive Major Economic Events
ProductInfo.Discription: From Nobel Prize–winning economist and New York Times bestselling author Robert Shiller, a groundbreaking account of how stories help drive economic events—and why financial panics can spread like ...
ProductInfo.Author: Robert J. Shiller

ProductInfo.BookName: The Code of Capital: How the Law Creates
ProductInfo.BookActualName: The Code of Capital: How the Law Creates Wealth and Inequality
ProductInfo.Discription: 'Capital is the defining feature of modern economies, yet most people have no idea where it actually comes from. What is it, exactly, that transforms mere wealth into an asset that automatically creates more wealth? .
ProductInfo.Author: Katharina Pistor

ProductInfo.BookActualName: The Turn of the Key
ProductInfo.Discription: From the #1 New York Times bestselling author of In a Dark, Dark Wood, The Woman in Cabin 10, The Lying Game, and The Death of Mrs. Westaway comes Ruth Ware’s highly anticipated fifth novel.When Rowan stumbles across an ad for a live-in nanny, she’s looking for something else completely. ..
ProductInfo.Author: Ruth Ware

ProductInfo.BookActualName: The Silent Patient
ProductInfo.Discription: The Silent Patient is a 2019 psychological thriller novel written by British-Cypriot author Alex Michaelides. The debut novel was published by Celadon Books, a division of Macmillan Publishers, on 5th February 2019. The audiobook version, released on the same date, is read by Louise Brealey and Jack Hawkins
ProductInfo.Author: Alex Michaelides

ProductInfo.BookActualName: Lock Every Door
ProductInfo.Discription: THE INSTANT NEW YORK TIMES BESTSELLEROne of . . . Parade’s “Most Anticipated Books of Summer 2019' 'PureWow’s “The Best Beach Reads of Summer 2019' BookBub’s Books That ...
ProductInfo.Author: Riley Sager

ProductInfo.BookActualName: The Suspect
ProductInfo.Discription: AN INSTANT NATIONAL BESTSELLER 'Utterly engrossing . . . I lived inside this book for two days--and I’m still thinking about it. Superb!' ..
ProductInfo.Author: Fiona Barton

ProductInfo.BookActualName: Run Away
ProductInfo.Discription: You've lost your daughter. She's addicted to drugs and to an abusive boyfriend. And she's made it clear that she doesn't want to be found. Then, by chance, you see her playing guitar in Central Park. But she's not the girl you remember. This woman is living on the edge, frightened, and clearly in trouble..
ProductInfo.Author: Harlan Coben

ProductInfo.BookActualName: The Night Fire
ProductInfo.Discription: Back when Harry Bosch was just a rookie homicide detective he had an inspiring mentor, John Jack Thompson, who taught him to take the work personally and light the fire of relentlessness for every case.
ProductInfo.Author: Michael Connelly

ProductInfo.BookActualName: Roald Dahl Matilda
ProductInfo.Discription: Matilda is a book by British writer Roald Dahl. It was published in 1988 by Jonathan Cape in London, with 232 pages and illustrations by Quentin Blake..
ProductInfo.Author: Roald Dahl

ProductInfo.BookActualName: The Cat in the Hat
ProductInfo.Discription: The Cat in the Hat is a children's book written and illustrated by Theodor Geisel under the pen name Dr. Seuss and first published in 1957. The story centers on a tall anthropomorphic cat who wears a red and white-striped hat and a red bow tie..
ProductInfo.Author: Dr. Seuss

ProductInfo.BookActualName: Goodnight Moon
ProductInfo.Discription: Goodnight Moon is an American children's book written by Margaret Wise Brown and illustrated by Clement Hurd. It was published on September 3, 1947, and is a highly acclaimed bedtime story. It features a bunny saying 'good night' to everything around: 'Goodnight room. Goodnight moon'
ProductInfo.Author: Margaret Wise Brown

ProductInfo.BookName: The Tiger Who Came to Tea
ProductInfo.BookActualName: The Tiger Who Came to Tea
ProductInfo.Discription: The Tiger Who Came to Tea is a short children's story, first published by HarperCollins in 1968, written and illustrated by Judith Kerr. The book concerns a girl called Sophie, her mother, and an anthropomorphised tiger who interrupts their afternoon tea.
ProductInfo.Author: Judith Kerr

ProductInfo.BookActualName: The Secret Commonwealth
ProductInfo.Discription: The Secret Commonwealth is a fantasy novel by Philip Pullman; it is the second volume of his planned trilogy, The Book of Dust.
ProductInfo.Author: Philip Pullman

ProductInfo.BookActualName: Caterpillar Summer
ProductInfo.Discription: Cat is the glue holding her family together. When her little brother Chicken has a meltdown, she knows just how to calm him, whether it's scratching his back or reading his favourite book. They've always had a special bond. .
ProductInfo.Author: Gillian McDunn

ProductInfo.BookActualName: History of India: A Captivating Guide to Ancient India, Medieval Indian History
ProductInfo.Discription: If you want to discover the captivating history of India, then keep reading...India is a land of mystery, richness, and deep spiritual discovery. Every facet of this ancient land seems scented with the famous spices that lured European traders to its shores more than five centuries ago
ProductInfo.Author: Captivating History

ProductInfo.BookActualName: India in the Persianate Age: 1000-1765
ProductInfo.Discription: Protected by vast mountains and seas, the Indian subcontinent might seem a nearly complete and self-contained world with its own religions, philosophies, and social systems...
ProductInfo.Author: Richard Maxwell Eaton

ProductInfo.BookActualName: The Patient Assassin
ProductInfo.Discription: The Patient Assassin, A True Tale of Massacre, Revenge and the Raj is a 2019 book based on the life of Indian revolutionary Udham Singh. Authored by Anita Anand, it was published by Simon and Schuster UK in April 2019 to coincide with the 100th anniversary of the Jallianwalla Bagh Massacre in Amritsar, India..
ProductInfo.Author: Anita Anand

ProductInfo.BookActualName: The Hindu Way: An Introduction to Hinduism
ProductInfo.Discription: The Hindu Way: An Introduction to Hinduism, the new book by bestselling author Shashi Tharoor, whose last three books have sold over a quarter of a million copies in hardback, is the perfect introduction to one of the world's oldest, largest and most complex religions. ...
ProductInfo.Author: Shashi Tharoor

ProductInfo.BookActualName: How to Hide an Empire: A History of the Greater United States
ProductInfo.Discription: For a country that has always denied having dreams of empire, the United States owns a lot of overseas territory. America has always prided itself on being a champion of sovereignty and independence. ..
ProductInfo.Author: Daniel Immerwahr

ProductInfo.BookActualName: Midnight in Chernobyl: The Untold Story of the World's Greatest Nuclear Disaster
ProductInfo.Discription: A New York Times Best Book of the Year A Time Best Book of the Year A Kirkus Reviews Best Nonfiction Book of the Year 2020 Andrew Carnegie Medals for Excellence Winner From journalist Adam Higginbotham,
ProductInfo.Author: Adam Higginbotham

ProductInfo.BookActualName: The Uninhabitable Earth
ProductInfo.Discription: The Uninhabitable Earth: Life After Warming is a 2019 book by David Wallace-Wells about the consequences of global warming. It was inspired by the New York magazine article 'The Uninhabitable Earth'..
ProductInfo.Author: David Wallace-Wells

ProductInfo.BookActualName: Something Deeply Hidden
ProductInfo.Discription: Something Deeply Hidden: Quantum Worlds and the Emergence of Spacetime is a non-fiction book by American theoretical physicist Sean M. Carroll. The book, his fifth, was released on September 10, 2019 by Dutton...
ProductInfo.Author: Sean M. Carroll

ProductInfo.BookActualName: Bottle of Lies: The Inside Story of the Generic Drug Boom
ProductInfo.Discription: A NEW YORK TIMES BESTSELLER New York Times 100 Notable Books of 2019New York Public Library Best Books of 2019 Kirkus Reviews Best Health and Science Books of 2019Science Friday Best Books of 2019 New..
ProductInfo.Author: Katherine Eban

ProductInfo.BookActualName: The First Cell: And the Human Costs of Pursuing Cancer to the Last
ProductInfo.Discription: A world-class oncologist's devastating and deeply personal examination of cancerWe have lost the war on cancer. We spend $150 billion each year treating it, yet -- a few innovations notwithstanding -- a patient with cancer is as likely to die of it as one was fifty years ago...
ProductInfo.Author: Azra Raza

ProductInfo.BookActualName: Infinite Powers: How Calculus Reveals the Secrets of the Universe
ProductInfo.Discription: Shortlisted for the Royal Society Science Book Prize 2019A magisterial history of calculus (and the people behind it) from one of the world's foremost mathematicians.This is the captivating story of mathematics' greatest ever idea: calculus..
ProductInfo.Author: Steven Strogatz

ProductInfo.BookActualName: Clearing the Air: SHORTLISTED FOR THE ROYAL SOCIETY SCIENCE BOOK PRIZE 2019
ProductInfo.Discription: **SHORTLISTED FOR THE ROYAL SOCIETY INSIGHT INVESTMENT SCIENCE BOOK PRIZE 2019**'Read this book and join the effort to terminate air pollution.' Arnold SchwarzeneggerAir pollution has become the world's greatest environmental health risk, and science is only beginning to reveal its wide-ranging effects.
ProductInfo.Author: Tim Smedley

ProductInfo.BookActualName: The Age of AI: Artificial Intelligence and the Future of Humanity
ProductInfo.Discription: Are robots going to take my job? How are smartphones affecting my kids? Do I need to worry about privacy when I get online or ask Siri for directions? .
ProductInfo.Author: Jason Thacker

ProductInfo.BookActualName: The Internet in Everything: Freedom and Security in a World with No Off Switch
ProductInfo.Discription: A compelling argument that the Internet of things threatens human rights and security and that suggests policy prescriptions to protect our future The Internet has leapt from human-facing display screens into the material objects all around us
ProductInfo.Author: Sean M. Carroll

ProductInfo.BookActualName: Cyber Minds: Insights on Cybersecurity Across the Cloud, Data, Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, and IoT to Keep You Cyber Safe
ProductInfo.Discription: Cyber Minds brings together an unrivalled panel of international experts who offer their insights into current cybersecurity issues in the military, business, and government.Key FeaturesExplore the ....
ProductInfo.Author: Shira Rubinoff

ProductInfo.BookActualName: T‑Minus AI: Humanity's Countdown to Artificial Intelligence and the New
ProductInfo.Discription: Late in 2017, the global significance of the conversation about artificial intelligence (AI) changed forever. China put the world on alert when it released a plan to dominate all aspects of AI across the planet. ...
ProductInfo.Author: Michael Kanaan

ProductInfo.BookActualName: Digital Transformation: Survive and Thrive in an Era of Mass Extinction
ProductInfo.Discription: From visionary Silicon Valley entrepreneur Tom Siebel comes a penetrating examination of the new technologies that are disrupting business and government—and how organizations can harness them to transform into digital enterprises.
ProductInfo.Author: Thomas Siebel

ProductInfo.BookActualName: Blockchain 2035: The Digital DNA of Internet 3.0
ProductInfo.Discription: The 2020s and 2030s will be witness to some of the most rapid, significant, and tumultuous changes in world history. The monetary and information systems that defined the late 20th and early 21st centuries will face their natural limits in the coming decade and quickly get disrupted by swift technological innovation. .
